xxl.io
Class StreamQueue

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.collections.AbstractQueue
        |
        +--xxl.io.StreamQueue
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlockBasedQueue, ListStreamQueue, RandomAccessFileQueue
public abstract class StreamQueue
extends AbstractQueue

This class provides a queue that uses a data input stream and a data output stream to store its elements. Neither the peek method nor the remove method are implemented by the stream queue. A converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.

Implementations of this class must only specify implementations for the inputStream and outputStream methods. These methods must implement the functionality of opening an input or output stream on the serialized elements of this queue.

See Also:
AbstractQueue, BufferedInputStream, BufferedOutputStream, DataInputStream, DataOutputStream, Function, InputStream, IOException, NoSuchElementException, OutputStream, WrappingRuntimeException

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a default stream queue (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). This field is set to RandomAccessFileQueue.FACTORY_METHOD.

converter

protected Converter converter
A converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of this queue.

size

protected int size
The number of elements in this file stack queue. It must be set explicitly by every implementation of StreamQueue.

dataInputStream

protected DataInputStream dataInputStream
The data input stream is used for reading the elements of the queue.

dataOutputStream

protected DataOutputStream dataOutputStream
The data output stream is used for writing elements to the queue.

inputBufferSize

protected Function inputBufferSize
A function that returns the size of the input buffer when it is invoked. Every time the queue switches (implicitly) from output mode to input mode, the function is invoked in order to determine the size of the input buffer. A function is used instead of an integer to guarantee highest flexibility, i.e. the result of an invocation can depend on the size of the available memory etc.

outputBufferSize

protected Function outputBufferSize
A function that returns the size of the output buffer when it is invoked. Every time the queue switches (implicitly) from input mode to output mode, the function is invoked in order to determine the size of the output buffer. A function is used instead of an integer to guarantee highest flexibility, i.e. the result of an invocation can depend on the size of the available memory etc.
Constructor Detail

StreamQueue

public StreamQueue(Converter converter,
                   Function inputBufferSize,
                   Function outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new stream queue that uses the specified converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.
Parameters:
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.

StreamQueue

public StreamQueue(Converter converter,
                   Function newObject,
                   Function inputBufferSize,
                   Function outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new stream queue that uses the specified converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The factory method is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the output stream is read out. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.
This constructor is equivalent to the call of StreamQueue(new UniformConverter(converter, newObject), inputBufferSize, outputBufferSize).
Parameters:
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.
newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the input stream is read out.
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.

StreamQueue

public StreamQueue(Function newObject,
                   Function inputBufferSize,
                   Function outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new stream queue that uses a convertable converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The factory method is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the output stream is read out. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.
This constructor is equivalent to the call of StreamQueue(ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, newObject, inputBufferSize, outputBufferSize).
Parameters:
newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the input stream is read out.
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.
See Also:
ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE
Method Detail

inputStream

protected abstract InputStream inputStream()
                                    throws IOException
Opens an input stream for reading the serialized elements of the queue and returns it. This method must implement the functionality for opening an input stream on the serialized data of this queue.
Returns:
an input stream for reading the serialized elements of the queue.

outputStream

protected abstract OutputStream outputStream()
                                      throws IOException
Opens an output stream for writing serialized elements to the queue and returns it. This method must implement the functionality for opening an output stream on the serialized data of this queue.
Returns:
an output stream for writing serialized elements to the queue.

read

protected Object read()
               throws IOException
Reads (removes) an object from the queue and returns it.
This implementation opens the data input stream and reads the object from it by using converter.
Returns:
the next element in the queue.
Throws:
if - an I/O error occurs.

write

protected void write(Object object)
              throws IOException
Writes (inserts) an object to the queue.
This implementation opens the data output stream and writes the object to it by using converter.
Parameters:
object - the object to be inserted into the queue.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

size

public int size()
Returns the number of elements in this queue.
Overrides:
size in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
the number of elements in this queue.

insert

public void insert(Object object)
Appends the specified element to the end of this queue.
This implementation writes (inserts) the object to the queue and increases size.
Overrides:
insert in class AbstractQueue
Parameters:
object - element to be appended to the end of this queue.

next

public Object next()
            throws NoSuchElementException
Returns the next element in the queue.
This implementation reads (removes) the next object from the queue, decreases size and returns the object.
Overrides:
next in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
the next element in the queue.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - queue has no more elements.

clear

public void clear()
Removes all of the elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
This implementation opens the data input stream and skips over and discards all data from it. Thereafter the data input stream is closed and size is set to 0.
Overrides:
clear in class AbstractQueue

openInput

protected void openInput()
Opens a data input stream for reading the elements of the queue and sets dataInputStream to it.
This implementation close any data output stream on this queue and invokes inputBufferSize. When the result of this invocation is 0, dataInputStream is set to an data input stream wrapping the result of calling the inputStream method. Otherwise the input stream is buffered by using a BufferedInputStream before it is wrapped.

closeInput

protected void closeInput()
Closes the data input stream on this queue when it is open.

openOutput

protected void openOutput()
Opens a data output stream for writing elements to the queue and sets dataOutputStream to it.
This implementation close any data input stream on this queue and invokes outputBufferSize. When the result of this invocation is 0, dataOutputStream is set to an data output stream wrapping the result of calling the outputStream method. Otherwise the output stream is buffered by using a BufferedOutputStream before it is wrapped.

closeOutput

protected void closeOutput()
Closes the data output stream on this queue when it is open.

close

public void close()
Closes this queue and releases any system resources associated with it. This operation is idempotent, i.e., multiple calls of this method takes the same effect as a single call.
This implementation closes the data input stream and data output stream on this queue.
Overrides:
close in class AbstractQueue
